Has anyone really seen Lord Hanuman?

Yes my maternal grandfather (Nana) has seen Lord Hanuman. My nana lives in alwar district of Rajasthan . In alwar district there is a small Hanuman temple situated on the outskirts of sariska national park on the mountains believed to be built by some king in the past. So at that time my mama (maternal uncle) was divorced and as we know the Indian court is biased towards ladies in cases of divorce, the lady won the case and my mama had to pay a huge sum of money to her. My nana used to so so much depressed at those times. Someone told him about the Hanuman temple that was situated on the mountains. He pledged that he will go to that temple every Tuesday . There were very few people who used to go to that temple as it was in an isolated place. My nana used to find so much satisfaction after going to the temple.He used to offer Prasad,meditate in the temple and also read Hanuman chalisa. The temple priest also knew my nana now since he was a regular comer to the temple. 34 months passed like that. That Tuesday was in the month of monsoon and the weather was very bad , though it was early evening but it was very dark outside and there were dark clouds in the sky. My maternal grandmother ( nani) asked my nana not to go to the temple today as the weather was not good and the temple was situated on a mountain (though there was a good road going to the temple because nearby there was a ruined fort which was indian archeological site but still it was unsafe). My nana told my Nani that he should not break his pledge of never missing going to the temple on Tuesday. So my nana started his Alto car and proceeded to go to the temple. Finally he reached the temple with his Prasad . He gave the Prasad to the familiar priest and exchanged good evening with him. The priest took the Prasad and put it in front of the Hanuman idol. My nana started coming back from the temple towards the place where he has parked his car. Then he was shocked to see the same priest he met just now coming from the opposite direction towards the temple. He said to my nana are chaudhary Sahab AP aj aye ho , muje to laga aj mausam bahut kharab Hai to koi nhi ayega isliye mandir ka taala lagane hi ja Raha tha English ooh chaudhary Sahab u have come today I thought that the weather is so bad today and no one is going to come so I was coming to lock the temple . My nana was so much shocked that the priest he just met and gave Prasad was standing in front of him and don't even that he had come. My nana was 100% sure that he had met the priest and offered the Prasad. My nana didn't say anything to the priest and came back home and narrated the whole incident to my nani.

My nana believes that it was Lord Hanuman himself who met him in the avatar of the priest and took the Prasad himself from him.

After this incident the whole of my family from the maternal side got very happy and never used to be sad and their condition gradually became very good . My mama got a really nice job in Delhi and later married a lovely lady ( who is presently my maternal aunt (Mami) :)

My nana still goes to the Temple every Tuesday and we also go with him whenever we go to my nana's house.

I am a disciple of Lord Hanuman. The following is what I have learned from Setuu (27 Chapters and 55 pages of replies to devotee queries), the book Immortal Talks, through meditation and replies I have received via other ways. I have seen Lord Hanuman in the inner world as well as other Supreme Souls.

  1. Lord Hanuman is still here in this world. To see Him in the physical world, one needs to rise to the level of the soul as he can only be seen by Atma Gnana. To see him in the inner world via meditation or visions your desire must be firm. He has not gone anywhere, it is humankind who have fallen too far into the pits of maya, karma and ignorance.
  2. He has made his presence public via Setuu, albeit in a very limited way. Nevertheless, according to those who transcribe his words, this means that Lord Kalki has either been born or is to be born soon. It also means that Kali Yuga is ending. According to Setuu, Lord Shiva had awoken from meditation in this world in 2014, and will not reenter meditation, which means Lord Shiva will be performing His Dance of Destruction once Lord Kalki has completed his work.
  3. Lord Hanuman's immortality is because His physical body disintegrates and reintegrates from moment to moment, too fast for eyes to see. His feet do not touch the earth as He walks. There is a ritual called washing of Lord Hanuman's feet, where the Lord walks across a reservoir of water to his asana, and as he walks impure particles from his body are ejected and replaced by the pure particles of water.
  4. He is in the light that falls into your eyes, it is he who tastes the fruits that his devotees eat.
  5. He is in the form of a monkey for two reasons. When a soul, even a Supreme Soul like Lord Hanuman remains in the same body for a long time as he does in this world, it becomes easy for the Soul to forget his true identity. So, the identity of a monkey helps keep Lord Hanuman free from the clutches of Maya as he serves His divine purpose. Secondly, as long as those who worship Lord Hanuman do not realise that the world appears differently to the other species in this world their worship remains incomplete. That is why the story of Lord Hanuman eating the Fruit of Immortality (the Sun as it appears to monkeys) is there. The decision as to his form was by the Supreme Souls of Lord Brahma, Lord Vishnu and Lord Shiva. Lord Hanuman serves the purpose of Lord Vishnu primarily here, to help guide human souls to Moksha.
  6. His devotees become connected to Lord Vishnu, Lord Shiva and Maa Lakshmi via the cord of faith they have in Lord Hanuman as Lord Hanuman in turn is deeply connected to the Supreme Souls named. This protects his devotees from pain, bad luck and moving away from the path of Moksha as long as the devotee remains connected to Lord Hanuman.
  7. To get guidance simply repeat the Mantra Raam which will bring the attention of Lord Raam (Vishnu) to you regardless of how deeply mired you are in the pits of Maya, Karma or ignorance.
  8. Anyone can pray to Raam. Even saying Raam by accident will bring his guidance to you.
  9. The Gods are Real. Let that sink in.

I was never religious, I just did the bare minimum without much faith. But what I have experienced and learned the past few years since I discovered meditation and then Setuu has changed everything I know and believed.

Lord Hanuman remains in this world from Treta Yuga until the end of Kali Yuga to assist the human souls as well as the Rishis aka Siddha Yogis aka True Enlightened Masters in fulfilling their purpose. And we have only one real purpose, Moksha.

//Raam//

Do you believe in astrology, and why or why not?

I never used to believe in Astrology and would hate it when my parents would follow it. But as life is unpredictable, I ended up believing in it and became one of those. Below is my story:

I often come across this question from my friends in a very astonishing way, How come you into Astrology?, as I had mocked everyone who ever talked about astrology. However, today I can share my journey with everyone.

Back in 2013, I quit my job with Nomura to pursue my dreams but things didnt go as planned and I struggled for a year and exhausted my savings. To make ends meet, I went back to Mumbai and did some odd jobs as I was not getting shortlisted for any technology job interviews, citing a gap of one year. After some networking, an old colleague referred me to BNP Paribas and I got the job at a pay cut.

After working there for a year, I got in touch with one of my school friends, who later went to IIT Delhi, and we both planned to start an IT services company. It was time to put down the papers yet again, and I typed the resignation letter with full enthusiasm (that time I didnt have to look for email templates on Google) but I got very anxious before sending it, as the old struggling days started haunting me.

As I was staring dead at the resignation email, one of my colleagues came over and inquired, Is everything okay? You look lost. I showed her my resignation letter and told her how my negative thoughts are not letting me do what I wanted to.

She looked at me with empathy and said, I can see your birth chart and tell you what to do as per Astrology. What are your birth details? and she opened one very badly designed app on her phone to input my details. I was shocked and amused at the same time. I promised myself to hire good UI/UX designers to develop better apps than that).

Seriously? Do you think I believe in all this? Padhe likhe hoke aap andh vishwas faila rahe ho! I scolded her but I wished I could get some help.

She waited for me to complete and demanded, Are you done? Now tell me your birth details. I dont care if you believe or not but let me try to help. I shared the details as I would rather not mess with a senior. But knowing her coding skills, I could totally judge that she would screw up in Astrology as well.

As she was analysing my chart, I waited curiously to know the outcome, the way I had waited for my 10th standard board results. There is something about Astrology, it doesnt matter whether you believe in it or not, but it fascinates you like nothing else. However, as I didnt trust her and would never have liked to take a biased decision based on Astrology, so I quickly sent the resignation letter and locked my screen. Meanwhile, she was done with her calculations and it was time for the results.

You are Leo Ascendant and your Sun is exalted I interrupted her in between and asked, I dont understand all this. Tell me something about the past to make me believe you, I was such a spoiler.

Beta, jitna tu bhaagta hai na isse, aage jake utna jaada believe karega (Dear, as much as you are mocking this today, you will believe in it much more, in future), She mocked me this time but after hearing that I was convinced she knew Astrology as good as Database designing, as I would never do that.

You dont choose Astrology, Astrology chooses you

Then she told me many things about my past to make her point including the date of my accident in school days, which was shocking. And once she observed the change in my body language, she stopped telling about the past and came to the main question. She not only predicted the past correctly but was also such a nice observer of behaviour. Oh God! Why the hell was she a MySQL developer?

Yes, you can quit your job as the next two years are very promising for an IT business as per the placement of Saturn and Rahu, she smiled as she made the prediction. I am still not sure if that smile was for a positive prediction or for the virtual win over me.

Just two years?, I exclaimed with a sheepish laugh as I had to pretend that I was not interested.

Like every other story, this story was also filled with some twist and turns. The twist was that my business partner might leave after two years from then and I would face some issues in resuming the business and it might take a year to pivot to a new venture, But you will make it she assured after observing my not-so-good body language.

You can press the send button, she finally said something with a real smile as she observed that I wasnt mocking anymore and had surrendered myself, unlike a Leo.

After that, I served my notice period and came to Noida and started an IT services company named CodeYeti in April 2015. We managed to scale up very quickly to 45 employees, serving about 15-20 clients at a time and clocked a revenue of $0.5 million in the first year itself. We started working for big enterprises like Yamaha, GreenPly along with startups.

Everything was going well until my partner told me that he is not getting a kick from the services business and wanted to do a tech product. We spent the next six months on two products but ended up wasting capital as nothing seemed to work and he finally quit in March 2017 to do something else.

And that reminded me about the prediction, my ex-colleague had made about my partners exit. I called her after a gap of two years (Lets just assume that I was busy and was not bad at keeping in touch) and told her about the prediction.

I could sense the happiness in her voice as her prediction came true but she showed concern as it was a loss for me. To my surprise, she knew everything about CodeYeti as she followed our social media channels and congratulated me for what we had achieved in such a short duration.

Do you want me to check your chart again? she inquired.

I paused for a moment and proposed an idea, How about I start a product in the field of Astrology and I become your first customer? She halted for a few seconds and said, HmmmI had quit my job four months back for some personal reasons, and I can take out some time to work with you but I wont be very active, so you will have to find more astrologers. I can connect you with a few in my network

Yes Yes! You can work whenever you have time and you can interview and train other astrologers and we will keep hiring. You can become their mentor and take care of the department of Astrologers, I said in excitement.

HmmSo, when are we going live? she straight away asked for a deadline, the way she did at BNP. Some people never change.

And then, there was the ultimate turn I worked on developing the product and launched an MVP (minimum viable product) of AstroTalk within a month and assigned a dedicated technology & operations team to it. I called her as a customer and asked, How would AstroTalk do?

Current stats:

Total Installs: 95,00,000+

No of Astrologers: 5000+

Daily Consultations with Astrologers: 3,20,000 minutes over chat/call

Revenue: INR 70,00,000 daily

Repeat Rate: 13+ (Higher than Swiggy)

Rating: 4.9/5.0 (Highest in this industry)

Within 4.5 years of launch, we have changed the way people interact with Astrologers and gave 20+ years old companies a run for their money. There were two basic fundamental problems with companies in this industry, which we could fix very precisely.

  • Companies were run by Astrologers who lacked technology expertise and made a very low-quality product with the worst possible customer experience.
  • Companies were run by some decent technology people (still lacked a good UI/UX design) who had no idea about how to build a business. They just focused on making money and offered no customer delight. Customer support was so poor that they had a very poor repeat rate in an industry with such high demands.

However, I feel the biggest reason we could do so well was that I never believed in Astrology as I had seen so many fake astrologers my entire life, predicting everything incorrectly, which made people like me hate the concept of Astrology.

However, after getting an accurate prediction about my partners exit, even before starting the partnership, I started believing in it and I realized that the Astrologer could be wrong, but Astrology is always right. Do temples of Lord Hanuman exist outside India?

Yes, there are temples of Lord Hanuman abroad, outside India. Some of the famous temples are P

1.Panchmukhi Hanuman Temple in Karachi ,Pakistan. It is the only temple in the world which has a natural statue of Hanuman. It is a 1,500 year old temple. It is declared as a national heritage under the Sindh Cultural Heritage (Preservation) Act 1994.

Panchmukhi Idol in Pakistan Hanuman Temple- Natural Hanuman Statue

2.Sri Anjaneyar Temple is Hanuman Temple which is located in Port Dickson, Malaysia. It has a very unique story. It is believed that when the idol of Hanuman was installed in the temple, the idol sat straight. However, after some time it changed its position and turned slightly towards the left, facing the sea. People from all over the world visit this temple to seek the blessings of Lord Hanuman.

Sri Anjaneyar Hanuman Temple, Malaysia

3.Trinidad is a place that holds the largest Hanuman Temple in the world (outside India). The temple has an 85 meters tall statue of Lord Hanuman. The idol is painted in pink and orange with golden accessories. The temple is right adjacent to a Dravidian-style temple. The statue was designed and constructed by the Chief Architect T. Subramanian Sthapathi from Chennai.

Trinidad (Caribbean)Hanuman Temple

4. Shri Hanuman Mandir is a beautiful temple located in Glen Oaks, New York. The temple holds a 5-faced idol of Lord Hanuman. The five faces of depicted are of Lord Hanuman in the center, Lord Narasimha, Lord Adivaraha, Lord Garuda and Lord Hayagriva on sides. The idol has 10 hands holding 10 different weapons. The idol is polished in silver and attracts a large crowd from all over the world!

5.Shri Hanuman Temple is a famous temple located in Brampton, Canada. This temple is managed by Swami Mohan Dass Sewa Samiti of Canada. The main deity in this temple is Lord Hanuman in a standing posture holding a mace (gada) in the left hand. Many other Hindu gods and goddesses such as Lord Shiva Rarivar, Radha-Krishna, Ram Darbar, Goddess Durga and Lord Vishnu with Goddess Lakshmi are also worshipped here.

Shri Hanuman Temple,Brampton, Canada

6.Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple, USA is a huge temple located in Mount Madonna Center. The temple offers an atmosphere of purity and provides retreats and classes on yoga, and meditation. One must visit this temple at least once.

Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple, USA

7.Shri Hanuman Mandir is a beautiful temple located in Glen Oaks, New York. The temple holds a 5-faced idol of Lord Hanuman. The five faces of depicted are of Lord Hanuman in the centre, Lord Narasimha, Lord Adivaraha, Lord Garuda and Lord Hayagriva on sides. The idol has 10 hands holding 10 different weapons. The idol is polished in silver and attracts a large crowd from all over the world!

Sri Sankat Mochan Hanuman Mandir, Glen Oaks, Queens, New York USA

8. Shri Veera Hanuman temple is located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The temple is built in Malaysian architectural style and has two different idols of Lord Hanuman. One idol is made of white marble, where the Lord is seated in a yogi posture while the other one is painted in green.

Kaula Lumpur

9.The Ramayana Cave is situated to the extreme left as one faces the sheer wall of the hill at Batu Caves, Kaula Lumpur. On the way to the Ramayana Cave, there is a 15 m (50 ft) tall statue of Hanuman and a temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, devotee and aide of Lord Ram.

Ramayan Caves - Batu Caves- Kaula Lumpur

How are bronze statues altered?

This is the Dick and Jane version so I will include some links.

The traditional way of making a bronze sculpture is to sculpt in clay or wax, make a plaster mold of the original, fill with wax, burn out with hot bronze (which is why it is called lost wax), chasing (clean up the wax)) and polishing. To make it large a 3 D Pantograph would trace the original into a larger form allowing the freedom to change and modify proportion and composition in the model before making the sculpture monumental size usually up to 10x max. (The bigger it gets the less detail). Before digital printing, a foam mold would be made from the small original and the pieces glued together to hold the poured wax. Changes would be made to the wax or clay by the artist.

In this case I suspect they created a digital model from the originals using computer modeling tools like Rhino, Zbrush, Autocad. The sculpture is then printed out and a rubber or silicon mold is made. Wax is next poured into the mold the old school way described above. The wax would have been altered by the artist before the sprueing (creating pathways for the bronze to go in)and the slurry for the cast is made (a hard plaster shell made by dipping the sculpture many times). Hot bronze is poured into the mould, melting the wax. Chasing (metal chasing done with with chisels & hammer) and polishing are the final step.

Here is the original bronze of a piece I did years ago. The sculpture was made into an edition of twelve shown next in wax. As each of the 24 hands was cast from 2 molds they have less detail as the wax was poured. I needed to correct individually to make sure each of the 12 quartz spheres (shown here at the foundry). The 3rd photo was for a mock up I did envisioning it monumental size for the World Trade Center Memoriam. It made the final 100 but went with something much better to honor the dead in the end.

Synergy by Uril Dana 1983, Bronze & Quartz, Life Size

Synergy Edition of 12 by Uril Dana 1983, Bronze & Quartz, Life Size

Synergy mock up for monumental size by Uril Dana .(The beginning of my meager Photoshop skillsthe radical new tech of the time).

How did Hanuman Die? That is a interesting question. Hanumanji is one of the Most revered Gods, Lord Shivas incarnation, and Ramachandra most Revered Devotee. Hanuman is Enternal or Immortal.Legend has it that Hanuman is immortal because he was blessed that he would be available to the devotees of Rama for as long as Ramas names and stories were on peoples lips. It is therefore strongly believed that Hanuman is present in places where Ramas glory is sung. Such footprints of Hanuman apparently still exist in all those places where the monkey-god walked. People worship these footprints and have also built small Hanuman temples in the vicinity of the places where such prints are spotted. Another thing is that, The events described in the Ramayana happened in the Treta Yuga. The Mahabharata happened in the Dwapar Yuga and led to the advent of Kali Yuga. We have mythological stories and anecdotes in the Mahabharata describing the meeting of Bhima, the second of the Pandavas and Lord Hanuman. These instances indicate Hanuman was there all through these ages. in this Yuga, which is Called Kali Yuga, few learned and wise people have reported seeing him. Sage Madhavarcharya was said to have been graced with Lord Hanumans visit in 13th Century AD. In early 1600s, Lord Hanuman apparently visited Tulsidas and inspired him to write the Hindi Ramayana entitled Ram Charit Mans. Ramadas Swami, Raghavendra Swami, Swami Ramdas and Sri Sathya Sai Baba were all have been said to have got the darshan of Lord Hanuman as well. Hanumanji therefore is, still alive.

How are bronze statues made?

It's called lost wax process. Copper ingots are melted. Once it's molten, tin can be added and mixed with a 2x4 lumber. If the tin was added before the copper melted, it would have evaporated. A wax model of the statue is built. Then covered in sand mixed with clay. (If you have no clay, then use cow or horse manure to bind the sand.) When the sand mold hardens. It is baked in an oven to melt the wax. Then molten bronze poured down into the mold. After several days of cooling. The sand mold is broken. And the bronze statue is trimmed of excess bronze.

Where was Lord Hanuman born?

Anjaneri is one of the forts in the mountain range of Nasik-Trimbakeshwar.

This hill got the place as Anjaneri, since Mata Anjanas son Lord Hanuman was born here.

It is a popular belief that Hanuman was born here, and other reason which signifies this is, the presence of Tryambakesvara Jyothirlinga of Shiva situated very close to this mountain.

  • A temple dedicated to Anjani, mother of Lord Hanuman is located here.
  • The temple is located in the Sahyadri Mountain Ranges, 20 kms away from Nashik.
  • And just 4 kms away from this temple is the mata Sita Gumhpa or cave, it is the place where Sita maa worshi

Who is Lord Hanuman?

Who is Lord Hanuman

Lord Hanuman is a Hindu deity and a devoted devotee of Lord Rama. He is a central character in the Hindu epic Ramayana and is revered as a symbol of selfless devotion, strength, and courage.

In the Ramayana, Hanuman is described as a vanara (a type of ape-like being) who assists Lord Rama, the prince of Ayodhya, in his quest to rescue his wife Sita from the demon king Ravana. Hanuman is known for his extraordinary strength and ability to fly, as well as his wisdom and devotion to Rama. He is often depicted as a monkey-like figure with a red face and a strong, muscular body.

Ha

Who is Lord Hanuman

Lord Hanuman is a Hindu deity and a devoted devotee of Lord Rama. He is a central character in the Hindu epic Ramayana and is revered as a symbol of selfless devotion, strength, and courage.

In the Ramayana, Hanuman is described as a vanara (a type of ape-like being) who assists Lord Rama, the prince of Ayodhya, in his quest to rescue his wife Sita from the demon king Ravana. Hanuman is known for his extraordinary strength and ability to fly, as well as his wisdom and devotion to Rama. He is often depicted as a monkey-like figure with a red face and a strong, muscular body.

Hanuman is worshipped by millions of Hindus around the world as a symbol of faith, strength, and devotion. He is also considered to be an avatar (incarnation) of the god Shiva and is worshipped as a god in his own right.

Why is Lord Hanuman depicted with five heads in some temples of India?

The panchmukhi form (vanara, narasimha, Garuda, varaha, haygreeva) is worshipping Hanuman as a 5-in-1 package. Hanuman has performed different leelas and this form of worship reminds us of his different powers. The first one, Vanara reminds us of his participation in the great fight between Rama and Ravana as one of the major warriors. Second form, Narasimha, reminds us of his leela where he killed the demon Simhika (who catches his shadow). Third form, Garuda, reminds us of his power to travel in air as he did during his great leap over the ocean to find Sita Devi. Fourth form, Varaha, remind

The panchmukhi form (vanara, narasimha, Garuda, varaha, haygreeva) is worshipping Hanuman as a 5-in-1 package. Hanuman has performed different leelas and this form of worship reminds us of his different powers. The first one, Vanara reminds us of his participation in the great fight between Rama and Ravana as one of the major warriors. Second form, Narasimha, reminds us of his leela where he killed the demon Simhika (who catches his shadow). Third form, Garuda, reminds us of his power to travel in air as he did during his great leap over the ocean to find Sita Devi. Fourth form, Varaha, reminds us of his leela of extracting the sanjeevani hill from Himalayas. Fifth form, Hayagreeva, reminds us of his prowess in language and vedas (he is named nava vyakarana pandita - expert in nine grammars). And as Mr AJ47 indicated, there are different benefits in worshipping in using that form. Hope this helps.

Was the Statue of Liberty bronze?

No, the Statue of Liberty was brown, color of copper. It is green now due to a scientific process known as oxidization. This is basically gaining oxygen in a way that involves subtraction of electrons, thus leveling up the valence. The copper aka brown color is under the green. The coating of green is of high density and abundance, in many places quite as much as the copper aka brown, coloration. The Statue of Liberty, as you likely know, was a gift from France to America. Copper handles lightning well, which is a pragmatic and useful idea and choice for a Statue situated at sea - which encounters lightning not uncommonly and cannot be protected at the time, due to its situation. And context; the copper handling lightning well, is a solid stylistic as well as technical choice, which befits the situation and location, of the famous American patriotic artwork.

Copper by the way, is also the material we use for our currency. US Pennies are copper. Lincolns face is on them, so this patriotic connection works well for the statue and ties in beautifully with its themes. And symbolism. Before the 1909 addition of Lincolns image, coins were engraved with some sort of icon - such as a Roman goddess - symbolizing the word: Liberty. For example, Libertas, a goddess associated with emancipation in Roman cultural history and their mythology. Anyway, copper has strong thematic and symbolic connections to freedom, Enlightenment heritage, and American patriotism.

Also, the copper torch can reflect sunlight. That supports the symbolism of Enlightenment. And symbolic imagery, style and themes of light, truth, and illumination. It is a kind of symbolic North Star. Signifying light and enlightenment, and enlightenment values leading to and behind the overall project of liberty and liberation. At night there are floodlights there: 16.

Technically, the title of the Statue is not the Statue of Liberty. Indeed, it is Liberty Enlightening the World. Hence, the symbolism of enlightenment is very important here, including but not only that copper sunlight-expressing torch. The copper torch specifically and statue generally, is meant to show how Lady Liberty guides her people to liberty, using enlightenment as her North Star and moral and navigational compass. So, the themes and symbolism of enlightenment - or Enlightenment - predominate, especially but not only with the reflective sun-bathed and light-glowing beauty of the torch, a visual peak and luminous apex and climax, of the visual art and drama, of this statue. Whose proper full name is Liberty Enlightening the World.

Continuing the light symbolism, and the light theme: the pointy parts of the crown are actually showing a halo, a la an angel. Or religious art. Specifically, it is meant to show a halo that radiates light outwards - not unlike the torch with its sun-expressing and -radiant beauty. And effervescence and illumination; light.

This is called an aureole. It is a special, unique kind of halo, one charged with spiritual, moral, and intellectual as well as, in this context political meaning. The aureole again adds to the light theme and light symbolism, and light name. Lots of connections to light here! And its imagery and themes and symbolism and names.

And, the aureole, introduces a dimension of regality and grace to the light theme and to the light symbolism. And imagery. But, it is an egalitarian kind of regality and grace. Expressing true royalty - that Lady Liberty is a child of G-d, and helping others. Not a child of an Earthly King but a child of the Heavenly King she is. Which is, the statue expresses, in some ways better or higher. And helping others = courage and leadership = the kind of royalty the statue expresses, believes in and radiates.

The aureole adds also, a religious and spiritual dimension to the intellectual and artistic dimension of the prior light naming pattern and imagery pattern. And light themes. Thus we know the naming and imagery, and themes, are also about spiritual light, inner light, personal light. The light of the soul, is part of the subject and expression - and themes and imagery - of the statue. It is about spiritual moral, not only intellectual and artistic - or political - light. Though all of this and more. The aureole expresses how spiritual light, inside light, leads to liberty and liberation. And is its own North Star, and source of light, not only in the heart and soul, but sea ( = environment/nation) and world. Spiritual light, is the North Star, the guide and inspiration, for liberty and liberation; and this for individuals, and nations both. And society and world. And democracy as such. Spiritual light helps lead people to freedom, and is a North Star that can and must lead to freedom. The aureole also adds a dimension of ethereality, a shimmering grace that balances and counterpoints as well as enhances the austerity and seeming sternness of the statue. There is a softness there. The aureole captures this sense of spiritual light and how this important value, leads to freedom. Not only artistic and intellectual, or political light; though these are present and expressed, and elaborated, too. And important. The statue however also explores spiritual light and identifies this as a source of leadership and courage too. And ultimately of liberty and liberation. Spiritual light leading to liberty and liberation and being a touchstone or talisman of freedom and a North Star the same, are expressed by the lofty and graceful spirited, spiritual aureole.

The torch part is closed now. It was closed due to the Black Tom explosion on 1916 which occurred on July 30. Only the National Park Service Staff handle torch matters and even they are necessitated and required, to a lengthy - forty-feet - climb. Thats how the torch stays lit. And in the right light, it looks pretty lit. The crown area is mostly open however to visitation and people can go see and attend by contacting New York City Statue Tickets & Tour Experiences | City Experiences - not now due to the global pandemic, but otherwise, yes indeed.

Theres more religious and spiritual symbolism. Lady Liberty also carries tablets of law. This is a symbolic evocation of the Ten Commandments. Its saying, follow the rules for a free society.

On the law tablets of the art, are engraved:

July 4, 1776

This is written in Roman way.

It is located with body and face slanted to Southeast direction. It is in Fort Wood, a careful and deliberate placement and architectural choice. In addition, ships, embarking upon the harbor area, are thusly enabled to enjoy the view, sight, and vision of the famed distinguished Statue. Function and form meet! And add to the overall beauty and artistry of the classic work.

There is also a poem, engraved there. It was penned by American Jewish poet Emma Lazarus.

The New Colossus

Not like the brazen giant of Greek fame,

With conquering limbs astride from land to land;

Here at our sea-washed, sunset gates shall stand

A mighty woman with a torch, whose flame

Is the imprisoned lightning, and her name

Mother of Exiles. From her beacon-hand

Glows world-wide welcome; her mild eyes command

The air-bridged harbor that twin cities frame.

"Keep, ancient lands, your storied pomp!" cries she

With silent lips. "Give me your tired, your poor,

Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free,

The wretched refuse of your teeming shore.

Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me,

I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"

Emma Lazarus
November 2, 1883

The adjoining/surrounding Island and Museum are also named Liberty.

So no, it was not bronze. It was brown, copper color. The green is quite beautiful too, and resplendent and rather elegantly matching set against sea. Overall, a very radiant and classical yet modern art work with beautiful themes and messages. And imagery and symbolism. It is worth seeing for that heavenly aureole alone. Do go see if you can: watching it seemingly float magically and nobly past, statuesque and crisply bold yet so warmly lovely and tenderly ethereal too, is one of lifes great delights - and awes.

Thanks for the question. Were quite proud of it here in New York City - and America.
